nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files

Interface AbsolutePath


  • public interface AbsolutePath
    AbsolutePath represents a RelativePath on a specific FileSystem.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jason Maassen

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean endsWith(RelativePath other)
      Tests if this path ends with the given path.
      String getFileName()
      Get the file name, or null if the AbsolutePath is empty.
      FileSystem getFileSystem()
      Get the FileSystem to which this AbsolutePath is linked.
      String getName(int index)
      Get a name element of this path.
      int getNameCount()
      Get the number of name elements in the path.
      String[] getNames()
      Get the number of name elements in the path.
      AbsolutePath getParent()
      Get the parent path, or null if this path does not have a parent.
      String getPath()
      Get a string representation of this path.
      RelativePath getRelativePath()
      Get the RelativePath on the FileSystem.
      boolean isLocal()
      Is this AbsolutePath created by the local adaptor ?
      Iterator<AbsolutePath> iterator()
      Create an Iterator that returns all possible sub paths of this path, in order of increasing length.
      AbsolutePath normalize()
      Normalize this AbsolutePath by removing as many redundant path elements as possible.
      RelativePath relativize(RelativePath other)
      Create a relative path between the given path and this path.
      AbsolutePath resolve(RelativePath other)
      Resolve a RelativePath against this AbsolutePath by appending all path elements in the RelativePath to the path elements in this AbsolutePath.
      AbsolutePath resolveSibling(RelativePath other)
      Resolves the given path to this paths parent path, thereby creating a sibling to this path.
      boolean startsWith(RelativePath other)
      Tests if this path starts with the given path.
      AbsolutePath subpath(int beginIndex, int endIndex)
      Returns a relative Path that is a subsequence of the name elements of this path.

    • Method Detail

      • getFileSystem

        FileSystem getFileSystem()
        Get the FileSystem to which this AbsolutePath is linked.
        Returns:
        the FileSystem.

      • getRelativePath

        RelativePath getRelativePath()
        Get the RelativePath on the FileSystem.
        Returns:
        the RelativePath.

      • isLocal

        boolean isLocal()
        Is this AbsolutePath created by the local adaptor ?
        Returns:
        If this AbsolutePath is created by the local adaptor ?

      • getFileName

        String getFileName()
        Get the file name, or null if the AbsolutePath is empty.
        Returns:
        the resulting file name or null.

      • getParent

        AbsolutePath getParent()
        Get the parent path, or null if this path does not have a parent.
        Returns:
        a path representing the path's parent.

      • getNameCount

        int getNameCount()
        Get the number of name elements in the path.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in the path, or 0 if this is empty.

      • getNames

        String[] getNames()
        Get the number of name elements in the path.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in the path, or 0 if this path is empty.

      • getName

        String getName(int index)
        Get a name element of this path.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the element
        Returns:
        the name element
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the index is negative or greater or equal to the number of elements in the path.

      • subpath

        AbsolutePath subpath(int beginIndex,
                   int endIndex)
        Returns a relative Path that is a subsequence of the name elements of this path.
        Parameters:
        beginIndex - the index of the first element, inclusive
        endIndex - the index of the last element, exclusive
        Returns:
        a new AbsolutePath that is a subsequence of the name elements in this path.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the beginIndex or endIndex is negative or greater or equal to the number of elements in the path, or if beginIndex is larger that or equal to the endIndex.

      • startsWith

        boolean startsWith(RelativePath other)
        Tests if this path starts with the given path.
        Parameters:
        other - the path to test.
        Returns:
        If this paths start with the other path.

      • endsWith

        boolean endsWith(RelativePath other)
        Tests if this path ends with the given path.
        Parameters:
        other - the path to test.
        Returns:
        If this paths ends with the other path.

      • resolve

        AbsolutePath resolve(RelativePath other)
        Resolve a RelativePath against this AbsolutePath by appending all path elements in the RelativePath to the path elements in this AbsolutePath.
        Parameters:
        other - the RelativePath.
        Returns:
        the resulting AbsolutePath.

      • normalize

        AbsolutePath normalize()
        Normalize this AbsolutePath by removing as many redundant path elements as possible. Redundant path elements are "." (indicating the current directory) and ".." (indicating the parent directory). Note that the resulting normalized path does may still contain ".." elements which are not redundant.
        Returns:
        the normalize path.

      • resolveSibling

        AbsolutePath resolveSibling(RelativePath other)
        Resolves the given path to this paths parent path, thereby creating a sibling to this path.
        Parameters:
        other - the path to resolve as sibling.
        Returns:
        a AbsolutePath representing the sibling.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the path can not be resolved as a sibling to this path.

      • relativize

        RelativePath relativize(RelativePath other)
        Create a relative path between the given path and this path. TODO: explain.
        Parameters:
        other - the path to relativize.
        Returns:
        a AbsolutePath representing a relative path between the given path and this path.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the path can not be relativized to this path.

      • iterator

        Iterator<AbsolutePath> iterator()
        Create an Iterator that returns all possible sub paths of this path, in order of increasing length. For example, for the path "/a/b/c/d" the iterator returns "/a", "/a/b", "a/b/c", "/a/b/c/d".
        Returns:

      • getPath

        String getPath()
        Get a string representation of this path.
        Returns:
        a string representation of this path.
